WorkItem.Summary: Drag *.ts into Visual Studio 2012 project will not enable TypeScript integration

Comments.Message: I'm not able to reproduce the issue. Can you add some additional details (what do you mean by "enabled" ? Is the TypeScript Visual Studio Extension installed and enabled? what behavior do you actually see vs expect to see?)
I can confirm this issue also, dragging a ts file to visual studio does not set the TypeScriptCompile Build Action.

@RyanCavanaugh: When the *.ts file been dragged from Windows Explorer into Visual Studio 2012, the *.ts file unable to be reconized by Visual Studio 2012.  Which means when I build the web application, the *.ts won't compile into *.js file.  Do you understand?
I see what you mean now.

I have created a little GUI tool for adding TypeScript ability to Windows 8 HTML/JS App projects.

After initially converting your project, do these steps:

1.) Copy your *.ts file to your project folder.
2.) Change the extension to *.js!
3.) Re-run my tool and select the *.js file.
4.) Ready to rebuild!
